WorkItem.Description:
I install Configuration Section Designer, and it was generating code correctly.  but suddenly and without any reasons.  The cs file is no more generated, I got the following error message:

> The custom tool 'CsdFileGenerator' failed.  Guid should contain 32 digits with 4 dashes (xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx)

.
.
The message seems misleading, because I uninstall Configuration Section Manager, and I still getting the same message every time I right click on CSD file and click "Run Custom Tool".
WorkItem.Summary: Cannot generate cs file.   Misleading error message.

Comments.Message: I am getting a similar issue when I click run custom tool I see "The custom tool 'CsdFileGenerator' failed. Unrecognized Guid format". I've uninstalled and reinstalled and still no luck is there a workaround? It was working just fine then it just unexpectedly falls over??
I wonder if this has to do with a new project type being added to the solution. I'll look into this a bit more...

I uploaded a package with a possible fix to this issue for VS 2013 (see downloads). I will port to VS2012 ASAP. This release also attempts to resolve some issues related to "not a vs project" errors. It has received limited testing, so please report issues.
Potential Fix is checked in to TFS and in latest VS2013 package. Will close once it is deployed as download package for VS2012 and confirmed.
